intro: Hypochaeris laevigata subsp. angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf mouse-ear cress, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, often with five petals. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving them a slightly rough texture. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
